title.narrative: TACKLING SAIGA ANTELOPE HORN SOURCING AND TRAFFICKING IN MONGOLIA THROUGH AN EVIDENCE-BASED APPROACH TO IMPROVE LAW AND POLICY ENFORCEMENT ACTIVITIES

description.narrative: THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO REDUCE THREATS TO SAIGA ANTELOPE IN MONGOLIA BY DISRUPTING TRAFFICKING, STRENGTHENING LAW ENFORCEMENT CAPACITY, AND ESTABLISHING CHAIN-OF-CUSTODY AND STOCKPILE MANAGEMENT SYSTEMS. SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES OF THIS THREE-YEAR GRANT INCLUDE 1 ASSESSMENT OF THE PROPORTION OF HOUSEHOLDS RURAL AND URBAN THAT PARTICIPATE IN SOURCING AND TRADING IN SAIGA HORNS, 2 IDENTIFICATION OF ONLINE AND PHYSICAL MARKET POINTS FOR SAIGA HORN TRADE AND THE PREVALENCE OF INDIVIDUALS ENGAGED IN HORN TRADE AND TRANSPORT, 3 TRAINING FOR REGIONAL LAW ENFORCEMENT IN DETERRENCE THEORY AND PROBLEM-ORIENTED POLICING PRACTICES, 4 DEVELOPMENT OF A CHAIN OF CUSTODY SYSTEM FOR CONFISCATED HORNS, INCLUDING A HORN STORAGE AND MONITORING PROTOCOL, 5 DEVELOPMENT OF AND TRAINING RELATED TO PROTOCOLS FOR CARCASS HANDLING AND HORN REMOVAL WHEN INDIVIDUAL CARCASSES ARE ENCOUNTERED IN THE FIELD DURING PATROLS OR DURING MASS MORTALITY EVENTS.
